["When you work at Travelport you can make a difference on a global scale. As a Senior Data Scientist in Infrastructure Services, you’ll be joining a team that’s responsible for delivering truly innovative software that impacts our many customers and travelers around the world.

This is a focused-on driving data science solution to enable delivery with resolving incidents and preventing availability impact. The role will involve analyzing data through AI and generate the most important issues to understanding the data, while building predictive models of incidents likely to occur, so we can proactively prevent an incident.

Main Accountabilities:

Contribute to creation of roadmaps for data science domain ensuring alignment to Travelport Technology and Business Strategies and drive deployment of the best data science solutions to enable delivery of operational goals for system efficiencies, cost optimization and customer availability.
Leads efforts in artificial intelligence to achieve high quality deliverables that exceed customer expectations.
Contribute to thought leadership and drive the execution of diverse data science projects through proactive collaboration with the data science community within Travelport.
Accountability for follow through on design and delivery of assigned aspects of roadmaps.
Have the ability to discover new opportunities where advanced analytical techniques can be leveraged for solving business problems.
Uses business acumen to understand what drives the organization, which factors influence strategy, and how the data can contribute to measuring the success of our strategic initiatives.
Provides business metrics for the overall project to show improvements (contribution to the improvement should be monitored initially and over multiple iterations).
Leads the evaluation of data technologies.
Leads the development of proofs of concept.
Delivers complex statistical and machine learning/predictive models from both internal and external data to provide solutions, insights, and new opportunities for business and product.
Proactively identify improvement opportunities through systematic and rigorous measurement and analysis.
Performs tests based on different hypotheses to directly and indirectly impact different Key Performance Indicators.
Communicate analytical results in a way that is meaningful for business stakeholders and provides actionable insights.
Converses with and creates/delivers presentations to internal business leaders and as well as external groups.
Develops usage and access control policies and systems in collaboration with COE Architecture, data governance and data & analytics resources and partner in continuous improvement processes impacting data quality in the context of the specific use case.
Remain a subject matter expert in emerging data science practices and technologies and share emerging best practice and innovation with Travelport data science community.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field required; Advanced degree preferred [Masters preferred]
10+ years experience in Statistics and Quantitative Analysis. Highly advanced domain expertise and experience working across a diverse group of products/applications and related systems identifying key inter-dependencies
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel PowerPoint) Visio as applicable.
Practical comprehensive knowledge of using Microsoft Project / PPM as a planning tool and working in a Project Server Environment
Technical skills dependent on role and will range as below;
Advanced knowledge of DBMS query languages
Expert knowledge of at least one programming language (R, Python, Java, Weka, NumPy)
Working knowledge of additional languages expected.
Expert knowledge of statistical software packages (R, SAS, SPSS)
Advanced knowledge of big data technologies such as Spark or Hadoop
Advanced knowledge of data visualization tools such as GGplot, Qlikview, etc.
Intermediate knowledge of machine learning and deep learning framework
Preferred Qualifications:

Masters Degree in Statistics or related field; prefer a PHD
Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL, Hive, or Pig
Experience with NoSQL databases, such as Elastic Search, MongoDB, CouchDB, Cassandra, or HBase
Great applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, or regression
Good scripting and programming skills in Python, Perl, Java, C++, or Scala
Relevant experience in Big Data platforms like Hadoop and its eco-system"]
